headings: Become a school principal in Texas.
Admission Requirements, Degree Plan and Courses
M.S. in Educational Leadership with Texas Principal Certification
What Can You Do With an Educational Leadership Degree?
Why Earn My Educational Leadership Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Develop your cultural knowledge, leadership skills and instructional mindset as you gain a deep understanding of the Texas principal standards and competencies that will prepare you for your future in educational leadership.

Our degree is designed for Texas certified teachers interested in pursuing careers as school principals in Texas. Take advantage of our 100% online, eight-week courses that allow you to complete your degree in as little as one year. You will learn and demonstrate aspects of instructional leadership that are relevant and important for school administrators.

Our award-winning faculty stress personal contact and advising. They stay up to date on current trends in educational leadership and administration, and they are dedicated to providing the best possible online learning experience.
Tuition & FeesWe don’t sacrifice quality for affordability. Angelo State is committed to helping you achieve your educational goals with as little debt as possible.

ASU Distinguished Graduate ScholarshipsEarn our premier graduate scholarship based on your highest degree GPA. Once you are admitted to an ASU graduate program, you will automatically be considered. No application is necessary.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics indicates that the job outlook for school principals between 2019-29 will grow at a rate of 4%, with a projected 11,000 job openings in that ten-year time frame.

Our graduates are prepared for careers as elementary or secondary school principals or assistant principals, as well as in curriculum and instructional leadership or administration at the campus or district level.

Our faculty work closely with you to conceptualize the role of the principal as an instructional leader through course communication, announcements, emails, Zooms, personalized feedback and preparation for the two rigorous certification exams. Our candidate scores for the 368 Performance Assessment for School Leaders (PASL) exam are consistently above the state average, and scores for the 268 Principal as Instructional Leader exam are consistently high.

Enhance your learning through substantial field experience and networking opportunities within various courses. Our courses align with Kolb’s Experiential Learning Cycle and are designed to provide real-world, relevant experience to develop instructional leaders who will be able to step into these positions to improve instruction, student learning and the school culture.

Whether you’re pursuing a master’s degree, doctoral degree or certificate/certification, you have access to all the services in ourCollege of Graduate Studies and Research. You’ll find information and resources for everything from registering for classes and writing a thesis – to available graduate/teaching assistantships and graduate research opportunities.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
